I return to this house with my soul full of joy, responsibility and hope. #DayDream
I feel joy to have overcome challenges and honored the name of the Brazilian woman. #DayDream
The names of millions of anonymous warriors return to occupy, embodied in my figure, the highest rank of our great Nation. #DayDream
I incarnate another collective soul that extends even more my responsibility and my hope. #DayDream
The nation project that holds the deepest and most lasting popular support of our democratic history. #DayDream
This nation project has triumphed and remains, due to the great results achieved so far (...)
(...) and because the people understood that this is a long-term collective project. #DayDream
This project belongs to the Brazilian people and, more than ever, it is for the people and with the people that we will govern. #DayDream
From the extraordinary work initiated by the government of President Lula and continued by us (...)
(...) we have today the first generation of Brazilians who did not experience the tragedy of hunger.
We have rescued 36 million from extreme poverty, 22 million from my first government alone. #DayDream
Never have so many Brazilians ascended to the middle classes. Never have so many Brazilians won so many jobs with a formal contract.
Never has the minimum wage and other wages valued for so long and so vigorously. #DayDream
Never before have so many Brazilians become masters of their own homes. Never so many bras. had access to technical education and university.
Brazil has never lived such a long period without institutional crises. #DayDream
The institutions have never been so strengthened and respected, and corruption has never been so thoroughly investigated and punished. #DayDream
This act of possession is, above all, a ceremony of reassertion and enlargement of commitments. #DayDream
It is the inauguration of a new stage in this historical process of social changes in Brazil. #DayDream
I also want to renew, in this House, my commitment of permanent and obstinate defense of the Constitution (...)
(...) of laws, individual freedoms, democratic rights, broader freedom of expression and human rights.
In my first term, Brazil achieved a historic achievement: we overcome extreme poverty. #DayDream
But as I said - and I know it is the expectation of all Brazilians - the end of misery is only a beginning. #DayDream
Now is the time to continue with our project, to pursue new goals. #DayDream
It is time to improve what is good, correct what it takes and do what people expect of us. #DayDream
Yes, at this time, instead of simply ensuring the minimum necessary, we have to strive to offer as much as possible.
We will need, government and society of patience, courage, persistence, balance and humility to overcome obstacles. And we will win.
The Brazilian people want to democratize, more and more income, knowledge and power. #DayDream
The Brazilian people want education, health, and security of more quality. #DayDream
The Brazilian people want even more transparency and more fight against all types of crimes, especially corruption (...)
(...) and wants the arm of justice to reach everyone equally. #DayDream
I'm not afraid to face these challenges, because I know I will not face this fight alone. #DayDream
In the new mandate, we will create, through firm and sober action in the economy, an even more business-friendly environment (...)
productive activity, investment, innovation, competitiveness and sustainable growth. We will fight bureaucracy without ceasing.
There is no better than quiet, simplicity and love to receive our new year # Family # Peace # Love # Love Jordan # Jordan ... http://t.co/MazZxe5mHT
All this focused on what is more important and more priority: the maintenance of employment and the valuation of salary. #DayDream
More than anyone else I know that Brazil needs to grow again. #DayDream
The first steps in this process are an adjustment in the public accounts, an increase in internal savings (...)
(...) the increase of the investment and the increase of the productivity of the economy. #DayDream
We will do this with the least sacrifice possible for the population, especially for those most in need. #DayDream
I reaffirm my deep commitment to the maintenance of all labor and social security rights. #DayDream
We are aware that the expansion and sustainability of social policies require equity and correction of distortions and eventual excesses.
Let us + once defeat the false thesis that there is a conflict between economic stability and social investment and infrastructure.
I would now like to announce the new motto of my government. He is simple, direct and mobilizing. #DayDream
It clearly reflects our high priority and signals which sector the effort of all areas of government should converge.
Our motto will be: BRAZIL, EDUCATIONAL LANTERN! #DayDream
In calling "BRAZIL, PÁTRIA EDUCADORA" we are saying that education will be the priority of priorities (...)
but tb q we must seek, in all actions of the gov, a sense of formation, a citizen's practice, a commitment of ethics and republican sentiment
Only education liberates a people and opens the doors to a prosperous future. #DayDream
Democratizing knowledge means universalizing access to quality education at all levels, for all segments of the population.
Throughout this new mandate, education will begin to receive more expressive volumes of resources from oil and pre-salt resources.
Thus, our political determination will add more resources, more investments. #DayDream
Td q we are proposing converge for a major objective: to expand and strengthen democracy, democratizing power truly.
Democratizing power means fighting for political reform, listening carefully to society and social movements (...)
(...) and seek the opinion of the people to strengthen the legitimacy of the actions of the Executive. #DayDream
Democratizing power means vigorously combating corruption. Corruption robs the legitimate power of the people. #DayDream
Corruption offends and humiliates the honest and good workers, businessmen, and Brazilians. Corruption must be eradicated.
Brazil knows that I have never complied with any illicit or malfect. #DayDream
Brazil will not always be a developing country. Its destiny is to be a developed and fair country, and it is this destiny that we are building.
A nation in which all people have the same opportunities: to study, to work, to live in dignified conditions in the city and in the country.
A country that respects and preserves the environment and where all people can have the same rights: freedom of information and opinion,
(...) to culture, consumption, dignity, equality regardless of race, creed, gender or sexuality. #DayDream
I hereby commit to the Brazil that produces and with Brazil that works. #DayDream
I reaffirm my faith in politics that transforms people's lives for the better. #DayDream
I've been a few times near death and out of these situations I have left a better and stronger person. #DayDream
I am a former opponent of a regime of force that provoked pain in me and left me scars (...)
(...) but that never destroyed in me the dream of living in a democratic country and the will to fight and build this dream.
So I'm thrilled to say I'm a survivor. If I may, I mean, I belong to a winning generation. #DayDream
Two characteristics that bring me closer to the Brazilian people - he too, a survivor and a victor, who never abdicates from his dreams.
God has placed in my heart a heart full of love for people and for my country. #DayDream
But first of all a brave heart that is not afraid of the fight. #DayDream
A heart, yes, that shoots the chest with the energy of love, dream and hope. #DayDream
A heart so full of faith in Brazil that is not afraid to proclaim: we will overcome all difficulties, because we have the key to that.
This key can be summarized in a prayerful verse: "The impossible is done already, only the miracles are for later." #DayDream
Long live Brazil! Long live the Brazilian people! #DayDream
